name: Shell Variables
description: A collection of useful shell variables

System Variables.val: The name of the current host
A colon-separated list of directories to search for directories given as arguments to "cd"
The name of the file where your command history is stored
The maximum number of lines this file can contain
The maximum number of history lines that a running shell can access
The complete pathname to your login directory
The Internal Field Separator that is used for word splitting after expansion and to split lines into words with the read builtin command. The default value is <space><tab><newline>
Used to determine the locale category for any category not specifically selected with a variable starting with LC
A colon-separated list of directories to search when looking for commands

The default timeout for the read builtin command. Also in an interactive shell, the value is interpreted as the number of seconds to wait for input after issuing the command. If no input is provided it will logout user
Set the name of the default text editor

User Defined Variables.val: The value "My Example" is now set to the variable "EXAMPLE"

Display Value.val: Displays the content of the variable "EXAMPLE"
Displays the content of the variable "EXAMPLE"
Displays the content of the variable "EXAMPLE" with SOMETEXT appended to it
